params.taskDescription:
De Morgan’s Law for the negation of a disjunction states that <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>∨<!-- ∨ --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
  <mo>≡<!-- ≡ --></mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}(p \vee q) \equiv </annotation></semantics></math>____________.

params.taskDescription:
De Morgan’s Law for the negation of a conjunctions states that _____________ <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo>≡<!-- ≡ --></mo>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext> </mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <mtext> </mtext>
  </mrow>
  <mo>∨<!-- ∨ --></mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo>.</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\equiv {\text{ }}\text{~}p{\text{ }} \vee \text{~}q.</annotation></semantics></math>

params.taskDescription:
Apply De Morgan’s Law to write the statement without parentheses: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mrow>
    <mo>(</mo>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mtext>~</mtext>
      <mi>p</mi>
      <mo>∧<!-- ∧ --></mo>
      <mi>q</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>)</mo>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}\left( {\text{~}p \wedge q} \right)</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription:
Apply the property for the negation of a conditional to write the statement as a conjunction or disjunction: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>∧<!-- ∧ --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>r</mi>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}(\text{~}p \wedge q \to\text{~}r)</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription:
Construct a truth table to verify that the logical property is valid:  <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mrow>
    <mo>(</mo>
    <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
      <mtext>~</mtext>
      <mi>p</mi>
      <mo stretchy="false">→<!-- → --></mo>
      <mtext>~</mtext>
      <mi>q</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>)</mo>
  </mrow>
  <mo>≡<!-- ≡ --></mo>
  <mtext>~</mtext>
  <mi>p</mi>
  <mo>∧<!-- ∧ --></mo>
  <mi>q</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\text{~}\left( {\text{~}p \to\text{~}q} \right) \equiv \text{~}p \wedge q</annotation></semantics></math>.
